title: Emily Atack admits she needed 'strong' antidepressants throughout depression battle
text:

Emily Atack , 29, has candidly opened up about her battle with depression and ongoing struggle with sadness.

The telly star admitted that she began taking prescription medication towards the end of her relationship with now ex-boyfriend Jason.

The actress, who rose to fame after playing Charlotte Hinchcliffe in E4's The Inbetweeners, opened up about her mental health in an interview with OK! magazine.

(Image: Internet Unknown)

She said: "I started seeing my therapist towards the end of my relationship with Jason; I was also on strong antidepressants for a while."

She also admitted: "I definitely have days where I struggle to get out of bed. Doesn’t everyone?’"

Confessing that she was quite a 'sensitive little girl' growing up, Emily said she was in tune with her emotions but found that the most "charismatic people have the worst internal struggles".

(Image: LightRocket via Getty Images)

She added: "I used medication to get me out of bed in the morning during an incredibly tough time and to dry up my tears."

The I'm A Celebrity star explained that after a three year period on anitdepressants, she is finally "med-free" but also thanks her jungle experience for her new lease of life.

Emily believes her time in the Australian outback came at just the right time and 'taught her to see magic in the world again.'

(Image: ITV)

The star is now set to return to OZ next month to host I'm a Celebrity...Get Me Out Of Here! spin-off show Extra Camp .

Emily will join former Emmerdale actor Adam Thomas and comedian Joel Dommett for the nightly ITV2 show.

The pair will be replacing previous hosts Joe Swash and Scarlett Moffatt, who both announced they were quitting earlier this year.

(Image: Dave J Hogan/Getty Images)

(Image: ITV)

The trio of jungle fanatics will be joined by celebrity guests, dumped campmates and will go behind-the-scenes down in camp.

Former EastEnders star Joe Swash has taken part in 10 series since becoming a show regular in 2009.

Joe announced the sad news of his departue on Instagram with a picture of himself walking across the famous bridge after becoming King of the Jungle.

* I'm A Celebrity airs later this year on ITV
description: The Inbetweeners actress Emily Atack bravely opened up about her mental heath and confessed she 'struggled to get out of bed'
